intro: Hieracium stenoclinium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features upright stems covered in sticky hairs and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium stenoclinium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
